summary: John R. Tunheim was a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). The documents reflect his involvement in overseeing the declassification and release of JFK assassination records, requesting additional information from the CIA, and addressing concerns about the pace of declassification. He is mentioned in the context of ARRB's formal determinations, requests for information, and discussions regarding the release of CIA information related to the JFK assassination. His role involved ensuring compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 and working with the CIA to balance transparency with security concerns.
significance: John R. Tunheim's significance lies in his role as a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB), which was responsible for overseeing the declassification and release of government records related to the JFK assassination. His involvement was crucial in ensuring compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 and promoting transparency in the release of these historically significant documents.
